name: Start of Ramadan (approx.)
description: First day of fasting in Ramadan. Exact date depends on local moon-sighting.
importance: Fard fasting for those who are able. Month of Quran, dua and charity.

name: Eid al-Fitr (approx.)
description: Festival at the end of Ramadan after completing the fast.
importance: Day of joy, prayer, charity and family gathering after Ramadan.

name: Day of Arafah (approx.)
description: 9th of Dhul-Hijjah. Greatest day of Hajj. Recommended fast for those not performing Hajj.
importance: Reported to expiate sins of the previous and coming year by Allahâ€™s mercy.

name: Eid al-Adha (approx.)
description: Festival of sacrifice, following the Day of Arafah.
importance: Day of prayer, sacrifice (Udhiyah/Qurbani), charity and remembrance of Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him).

name: Ashura (approx.)
importance: Many scholars recommend fasting a day before or after along with it.

name: Ayyam al-Beed (White Days)
importance: Recommended to fast these days every month for consistent spiritual benefit.
note: Use Hijri date in the app to identify these days monthly.
